intro: Sloanea eichleri, commonly known as the Eichleri sloanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Sloanea eichleri produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
